nodes.bodyText: @azabbasi I saw that you made this cast be for PagedResponseBase, but I had to revert that change to make this function work. Is that okay?
Just fyi - this is correct, the return type of the add model PL API is of type Response, so it needs to be cast to ResponseBase. I've had to make the same change in the samples PR as well #14781
This is no longer required, we have switched the return type back to List and this is now outdated.
(Here and below) this function will always throw a null pointer exception or something similar, so I fixed it to just always return a Mono.empty()

+1
.map(Response::getValue) returns null, which is not a valid return item from a Mono. So we need to map it to Mono.empty() instead.
Not sure if it was deliberate, but the sync client didn't have the minimal API for creating models, so I added it. @azabbasi can you comment on if we need this API or not?
As @azabbasi confirmed, we will need this minimal sync API
correct, this API is now added in master.
I am not sure I follow this - aren't the created models returned as a result of this API call - PagedFlux<ModelData>?
Or is it that ModelData.model is null?
ModelData.model is null when the service returns it from a createModel call. I'm reworking this code a bit
I had been using org.apache.http.HttpStatus in the sample, but I like java.net.HttpURLConnection better; I'll make the switch.
I see java.net.HttpURLConnection used in the app configuration SDK code, so I'd recommend it
It might be useful to enable the logger as well.
Should these be private static final?
I see that this is an azure-core helper, so they maintain the list of http clients they test against; nice!
How's this logger being used?
For when we log statements during our tests. Currently nothing is logged, but this may be useful for later
I've added a few log statements to these model tests now
ul?
unordered list
We also have this functionality in the samples project.
I had to factor out some of the unique Id generation logic to the samples and e2e tests since the e2e tests need to record the random numbers that we generate.
I'm deleting this sample test because we don't need it anymore. The model tests will serve as the sample tests for now
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,42 +0,0 @@
-package com.azure.digitaltwins.core;

nodes.bodyText: This logic now lives in the samples

do we really have to set the endpoint on the playback client? it's not going to be using it.
regardless, I think  this comment is incorrect, it doesn't "connect" to anything :)
Our builder makes it mandatory that an endpoint is specified, so my hands are tied here

The previous implementation just used the playback endpoint if the environment variable for endpoint isn't set, which wasn't quite right. Now we always use the playback endpoint when the interceptorManager is in playback mode
we might not to do this for-each iteration, create models does not return a pageable anymore, so the blocking call should directly complete with result.

you can do
List<String> modelsList = new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(modelBuilding, modelHvac, modelWard))
